thread.title: Sans Aldridge, Spurs fall to Hawks

author: Dan McCarney
title: Sans Aldridge, Spurs fall to Hawks

(AP Photo/John Bazemore) Atlanta Hawks guard Kent Bazemore (24) scores as San Antonio Spurs forward Kyle Anderson (1) defends in the second half of an NBA basketball exhibition game Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015, in Atlanta. (AP ... more Photo: John Bazemore, Associated Press Image 27 of 27 Sans Aldridge, Spurs fall to Hawks 1 / 27 Back to Gallery Atlanta took advantage of LaMarcus Aldridge's absence and their opponents' decided indifference, dropping the Spurs to 0-3 in the preseason with a 100-86 victory Wednesday at Phillips Arena.
Aldridge sat out with back spasms after scoring 17 points in the Spurs' loss at Miami on Monday. His new team struggled without him, eventually conceding the lead for good in the face of a 14-0 Hawks run in the third quarter.
Kawhi Leonard, the only starter to play more than 20 minutes, led the Spurs with 20 points and eight rebounds. Manu Ginobili was the only other player in double-figures with 10 points.
